conversation.content: [bitter] So Rebecca messaged me. Rebecca fucking Martinez. After fifteen years, she just... sends me this long apology about everything she did in eighth grade. And I'm sitting here staring at my phone likeâ€” what am I supposed to do with this? [pause] I mean, I've told the story a thousand times. How she made my life hell. How I survived it, how it made me stronger. [very slowly] That's literally what I talk about in my therapy groups. [sarcastic] "Look at me, I'm proof you can overcome anything." [sigh] But now she's sorry? Now she gets it? And the worst part is, um... the worst part is she sounds genuine. Like she actually understands what she did. [frustrated] Which should feel good, right? Closure or whatever? But instead I just feel... [trailing off] I don't know. Empty? Like she just took something from me. Again. [very quietly] Because if she's not the monster I made her out to be, then what does that make my whole story? [pause] What does that make me?

subject: The classmate who bullied you in school just reached out to apologize, but you've built your entire identity around overcoming that trauma
